result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sophia Niesha Shelton

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond forfeited per court order.

Defendant Sophia Niesha Shelton not in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court in person for Sophia Niesha Shelton. 
Defendant failing to appear. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Atty Schwarz is on vacation for the next court date of 8/26/2022. Matter is adjourned to 9/21/2022 at 1:30pm. Parties are notified.

Defendant Sophia Niesha Shelton not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Ms Shelton is not produced from Waukesha. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Walmart 3355 S/ 27th St. Milwaukee WI 53215
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
Defendant Sophia Niesha Shelton in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Sophia Niesha Shelton in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
